Once again, it is a curious study, one of which the report would be endless, to observe how surely the separatist sees life in a proportion which appears false to the larges mind. For example, in the matter of profanity, how many of those who reprove whatever in expletive they consider an approach to it, will preach a doctrine concerning God’s character, attributing to him both bi— goted mind and wrathful temper, never asking themselves which is greater—the name, or the character that sanctifies the name. So, in every case, the tithing of mint and anise must arise, just as justice and mercy must fail, in a partial mind.
